nodes.text: Concussive absorbing material was a type of physical product that could be included in clothes. In 32 BBY, some of Queen Padmé Amidala's wardrobe was made of the material; during the Invasion of Naboo one of the Handmaidens used it to create headbands for themselves as protection.
Concussive absorbing material appears in the 2020 novel Queen's Peril, written by E. K. Johnston.
